titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation declaring His Majesties pleasure touching an office in London, for reformation of abuses in the dying of silks.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill,

notesStmt.note: Imprint from colophon; the dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
At end of text: ... VVestminster the seventh day of February in the fourteenth yeer of Our reign.
Arms 24; Steele notation: Dying his 2) Majesty 3) men 4) said other-.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
